alert.note: Alert for Pocahontas (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 13 at 5:58PM CDT until May 13 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Tornado Warning for... West central Pocahontas County in northwestern Iowa... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 558 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 6 miles east of Varina, or 6 miles southwest of Pocahontas, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Pocahontas County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
